instructions:
Set oven at 350 F. Rinse chicken thighs, pat dry and salt both sides. Combine slightly beaten egg with
milk in a shallow bowl. Combine above seasonings with flour and mix well. Dredge chicken in flour
mixture to coat. Then dip in egg mixture and coat again with flour mixture. Refrigerate for at least an hour.
Melt sufficient shortening for a depth of 1/4 inch in a cast iron skillet and bring to a temperature of 365 F.
Fry chicken on both sides until golden brown, about 8 minutes. Remove from frying pan and place on a rack
in a 350 F oven for 25 to 30 minutes or until done. May be frozen after baking. If frozen, heat in 350 F oven
for 40 to 45 minutes.
name: Crispy Fried Chicken
creator: Nathalie Dupree
